title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 921-6.5 - Strikes or lockouts
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 921-6.5 - Strikes or lockouts

State Regulations
(a) Nothing in this rule shall require an employer to serve written notice when
permanently replacing a person who is deemed to be an economic striker under
the National Labor Relations Act (29 U.S.C. 151
et
seq.). Nothing in this rule shall be deemed to validate or invalidate any
judicial or administrative ruling relating to the hiring of permanent
replacements for economic strikers under the National Labor Relations

Act. (b) This exception applies to
a strike or lockout that is not intended to evade the requirements of the

Act. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
921-6.5

Amended

New

York State Register June 21, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 25, eff. 6/21/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
